TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Transform extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the abstract base class from which all elements that can be used in an XML digital signature derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When performing XML signing and verification, the <`Transform`> element describes how the signer transformed the data object that was signed. The verifier of a document then uses the <`Transform`> element to transform the signed data in the same manner. If the verifier cannot transform the signed data in the same manner, the document cannot be verified.
Use a class that derives from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> class whenever you need to add one or more transform objects to an encrypted XML document or to a signed XML document.
For more information about the `<Transform>` element, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/, or the XML encryption specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Algorithm { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Algorithm : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the algorithm performed by the current transform.
Docs.value: The URI that identifies the algorithm performed by the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.Algorithm%2A> attribute of a `<Transform>` element in an XMLDSIG signature. For example, the algorithm URI for the Base64 decoding transform is defined as http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#base64 in the XMLDSIG specification (Section 6.6.2).
You can conveniently set this value using one of the static fields associated with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Xml::XmlElement ^ Context { System::Xml::XmlElement ^ get(); void set(System::Xml::XmlElement ^ value); };
member this.Context : System.Xml.XmlElement with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an object that represents the document context under which the current object is running.
Docs.value: An object that represents the document context under which the current object is running.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When signing a document, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.Context%2A> property represents the value passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> constructor. When verifying a document, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.Context%2A> property represents <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Signature> object.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.Context%2A> property is set automatically during signature computation and checking, but before transforms are invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetDigestedOutput(class System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm hash) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetDigestedOutput (hash As HashAlgorithm) As Byte()
abstract member GetDigestedOutput : System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm -> byte[] override this.GetDigestedOutput : System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm -> byte[]

Docs.param: The object used to create a digest.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the digest associated with a object.
Docs.returns: The digest associated with a object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNodeList GetInnerXml() cil managed
Protected MustOverride Function GetInnerXml () As XmlNodeList

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns an XML representation of the parameters of the object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG element.
Docs.returns: A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current object in an XMLDSIG element.

remarks.format:
## Examples If a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object represents an XPath transform using the XPath expression `self::text()`,a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.GetInnerXml%2A> results in an <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList> object that represents the following XML element:
``` <XPath> self::text() </XPath> ```
This element corresponds to the transform-specific content of the `<Transform>` element as defined in Section 4.3.3.4 of the XMLDSIG specification. For the above XPath transform, the entire `<Transform>` element is as follows:
``` <Transform Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-xpath-19991116"> <XPath> self::text() </XPath> </Transform> ```

Docs.summary: Returns the output of the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetOutput() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetOutput () As Object

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the output of the current object.
Docs.returns: The output of the current object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetOutput(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the output to return. This must be one of the types in the property.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the output of the current object of the specified type.
Docs.returns: The output of the current object as an object of the specified type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.GetOutput%2A> method returns the output of the current transform after it is run on the value previously set by a call to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.LoadInput%2A> method.
The type of the returned object must be one of the type objects in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.OutputTypes%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlElement GetXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the XML representation of the current object.
Docs.returns: The XML representation of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> object returned by this method conforms to the XML Scheme for the `<Transform>` element defined in Section 4.3.3.4 of the XMLDSIG specification.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property InputTypes As Type()
public: abstract property cli::array <Type ^> ^ InputTypes { cli::array <Type ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the method of the current object.
Docs.value: An array of valid input types for the current object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the method of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.InputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object must accept at least one type as valid input.
A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object typically accepts one or more of the following types as input: <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadInnerXml(class System.Xml.XmlNodeList nodeList) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub LoadInnerXml (nodeList As XmlNodeList)

Docs.param: An object that specifies transform-specific content for the current object.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, parses the specified object as transform-specific content of a element and configures the internal state of the current object to match the element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used to process subelements of a `<Transform>` element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadInput(object obj) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub LoadInput (obj As Object)

Docs.param: The input to load into the current object.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, loads the specified input into the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.InputTypes%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OutputTypes As Type()
public: abstract property cli::array <Type ^> ^ OutputTypes { cli::array <Type ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets an array of types that are possible outputs from the methods of the current object.
Docs.value: An array of valid output types for the current object; only objects of one of these types are returned from the methods of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The array returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.OutputTypes%2A> property must contain at least one element because every transform must generate at least one type as output.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PropagatedNamespaces As Hashtable
public: property System::Collections::Hashtable ^ PropagatedNamespaces { System::Collections::Hashtable ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a object that contains the namespaces that are propagated into the signature.
Docs.value: A object that contains the namespaces that are propagated into the signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks XML namespaces are used to distinguish different elements in a document that have the same name.
The <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> keys of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.PropagatedNamespaces%2A> property are the namespace prefixes and the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> values are the namespace Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs).
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.PropagatedNamespaces%2A> property is set automatically during signature computation and checking, but before transforms are invoked.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Xml::XmlResolver ^ Resolver { void set(System::Xml::XmlResolver ^ value); };

Docs.value: The current object. This property defaults to an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> class resolves external XML resources named by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). If you do not trust the source of the XML file, you might not want to allow the XML file to access computer resources named by the URI. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.Resolver%2A> property allows you to control the level of access that XML files have to computer resources by specifying different <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> objects. If you do not want to allow any access, you can set this property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
